oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Shawn Camp - 2017-08-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by songwriter Shawn Camp from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on August 26, 2017. Includes questions from the audience. Presented in support of the exhibit Loretta Lynn: Blue Kentucky Girl.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Shawn Camp;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (02:34) Opening comments and introduction by Abi Tapia / (06:23) Opening comments by Shawn / (06:33) Performs unidentified song likely titled Already Sweet On You / (08:40) Talks about writing the song with Herb McCullough / (09:10) Song introduction / (11:00) Performs Two Piña Coladas / (14:18) Song introduction / (14:29) Performs How Long Gone / (17:00) Song introduction / (17:58) Performs River Of Love / (20:12) Song introduction / (21:01) Performs Would You Go With Me / (24:42) Song introduction and story about first working with Loretta Lynn / (28:33) Performs I'm Dying For Someone To Live For / (31:58) Answers question about who Cowboy Jack Clement was and what he meant / (35:14) Answers question about words or music coming first and what writing songs is like / (37:15) Answers question about what makes you get better as a writer and his favorite songs / (38:16) Answers question about writing with Loretta /

(39:08) Answers question about hearing other artists singing his songs or wishing he had kept them for himself to sing / (40:26) Talks about Guy Clark and introduces the next song / (41:30) Performs Sis Draper / (45:21) Performs Magnolia Wind / (48:40) Song introduction / (49:16) Performs Live This Long / (52:40) Closing comments / (53:00) Walk-out music / (57:14) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Camp, Shawn; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
